review.title: A new belief Markov chain model and its application in inventory prediction
review.abstract: Markov chain model is widely applied in many fields, especially the field of prediction. The classical Discrete-time Markov chain(DTMC) is a widely used method for prediction. However, the classical DTMC model has some limitation when the system is complex with uncertain information or state space is not discrete. To address it, a new belief Markov chain model is proposed by combining Dempster-Shafer evidence theory with Markov chain. In our model, the uncertain data is allowed to be handle in the form of interval number and the basic probability assignment(BPA) is generated based on the distance between interval numbers. The new belief Markov chain model overcomes the shortcomings of classical Markov chain and has an efficient ability in dealing with uncertain information. Moreover, an example of inventory prediction and the comparison between our model and classical DTMC model can show the effectiveness and rationality of our proposed model.

The classic discrete-time Markov chain (DTMC) is a widely used method of prediction. However, the classic DTMC model has certain limitations when the system is complex with uncertain information or states. To address them, a new Markov chain model is proposed by combining the Dempster-Shafer evidence theory with the Markov chain. In our model, the uncertain data may be treated in the form of interval numbers and basic probability assignment (BPA). The new belief Markov chain model overcomes the shortcomings of the classical Markov chain and has an efficient ability to handle uncertain information. sections.heading: 1. Introduction
sections.text: A Markov process can be used to model a random system that changes states according to a transition rule that only depends on the current state. And, the Markov property is the most important property during the Markov process, namely the conditional probability distribution of the future states of the process depends only on the current state [23, 32, 34]. Markov chain is a stochastic process with Markov property [11]. It is widely used in many applications to study sequential data [1, 2, 19, 43], especially in prediction [21, 39], economic forecasting [29, 41] and so on. The Makov chain is a powerful tool for examining sequential data. It provides a set of models for analyzing time series data and predicting the tendencies of random processes, including discrete time Markov chain (DTMC).

sections.heading: 6. Conclusion
sections.text: The main advantages of the new model are: 1. Stability. The sudden change in the prediction result is avoided, namely, that the prediction result changes smoothly along the slight change in data.2. The ability to deal with uncertain information. Either the uncertainty of the state or the data can be handled effectively in our model.3. Flexibility. The different state distribution schemes and basic probability assignment functions can lead to different outcomes. The setting can be adjusted according to the realistic situation that reveals the flexibility of our model.3. A numerical example of the prediction of stocks is illustrated in the paper to show the application of our model.And the prediction result and the comparison prove the effectiveness and rationality of our model.
